There should be stricter gun control measures. It's crazy that in the most developed country in the world we still have school shooting.

From the viewpoint of many Republicans, I agree with you. The fact that school shootings continue to happen is deeply troubling, and it does show that something needs to be done to protect our kids and our communities.

While gun rights are important, there are actually Republicans who have supported common-sense gun control measures. For example, after the tragic Parkland shooting in 2018, Florida’s Republican Governor Rick Scott signed a bill that raised the minimum age to buy a rifle from 18 to 21 and created a waiting period for gun purchases (Source: [NPR – Florida Gov. Scott Signs Gun Bill](https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2018/03/09/592265522/florida-gov-scott-signs-gun-bill-after-parkland-shooting)). This law had support from several other Florida Republicans as well.

Many Republicans, like Senator Pat Toomey of Pennsylvania, have supported background check legislation, showing that there is room for agreement on measures that don’t infringe on responsible citizens’ rights but help keep dangerous weapons out of the wrong hands (Source: [Toomey’s website – Background Checks](https://www.toomey.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/toomey-manchin-introduce-background-check-bill-to-keep-guns-out-of-the-wrong-hands)).

What kinds of specific gun control measures do you think would help? Do you think banning certain types of weapons or focusing on background checks would be more effective? I’d like to hear your thoughts.
